Title.evidence: Intraoperative Dexmedetomidine and Postoperative Delirium: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive dexmedetomidine (0.5 µg/kg/h) or saline placebo during surgery and for 2 hours postoperatively.

Participants.evidence: elderly patients (>68 years) undergoing major elective noncardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive dexmedetomidine (0.5 µg/kg/h) or saline placebo

Objective.evidence: This multicenter, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial evaluated the effect of intraoperative dexmedetomidine on postoperative delirium

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of postoperative delirium, assessed daily.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, with allocation concealed via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding encompassed patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 404 randomized patients (202 to dexmedetomidine, 202 to placebo)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of postoperative delirium was comparable between the dexmedetomidine and placebo groups (12.2% vs 11.4%, P = .94).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similarly distributed between groups.
